question: Vô lý, lố bịch, ngớ ngẩn.
example: Men’s fashion was similarly absurd.
english-definition: Stupid and unreasonable, or silly in a humorous way.

question: Bệnh thiếu máu.
example: Instead, she needed to look as if she had anemia.
english-definition: A medical condition in which there are not enough red blood cells in the blood.

question: Tầng lớp quý tộc.
example: ...you would laugh when you saw how the aristocracy dressed.
english-definition: A class of people who hold high social rank.

question: Người quý tộc.
example: ...the aristocrats of Europe were very serious about their appearance.
english-definition: A person of high social rank who belongs to the aristocracy.

question: Trang phục, quần áo (thường là trang trọng).
example: The predominant style in women’s attire was enormous dresses.
english-definition: Clothes, especially formal or special ones.

question: Cơn sốt, mốt nhất thời.
example: Pale skin was also a craze, yet this too was done in excess.
english-definition: An activity, object, or idea that is extremely popular, usually for a short time.

question: Làm to ra, mở rộng, phóng to.
example: Ladies even used pads to enlarge the appearance of their hips and shoulders.
english-definition: To make something bigger.

question: Sự quá mức, sự thái quá.
example: Pale skin was also a craze, yet this too was done in excess.
english-definition: An amount that is more than acceptable, expected, or reasonable.

question: Nữ tính, yểu điệu, (thuộc) phụ nữ.
example: Today it would probably seem very feminine.
english-definition: Having qualities or an appearance traditionally associated with women.

question: Dấu hiệu đặc trưng, đặc điểm nổi bật.
example: The hairstyles, however, were the hallmark of women’s fashion.
english-definition: A typical characteristic or feature of a person or thing.

question: Miếng đệm, miếng lót.
example: Ladies even used pads to enlarge the appearance of their hips and shoulders.
english-definition: A piece of soft, thick material that you put on something to protect it or make it more comfortable.

question: Chiếm ưu thế, chủ yếu, nổi bật.
example: The predominant style in women’s attire was enormous dresses.
english-definition: More noticeable or important, or larger in number, than others.

question: Có uy tín, có danh tiếng tốt.
example: Reputable men wore wigs of long curly hair.
english-definition: Having a good reputation and able to be trusted.

question: Phấn má hồng.
example: ...the men wore lipstick and put rouge on their cheeks.
english-definition: A red powder or cream used for giving a pink colour to the cheeks.

question: Biểu thị, có nghĩa là, là dấu hiệu của.
example: ...for the clothing signified his wealth and status.
english-definition: To be a sign of something; to mean.

question: Dây đai, dây đeo, quai.
example: It took several maids stretching fabric and pulling straps...
english-definition: A narrow piece of leather or other strong material used for fastening something or giving support.

question: Một mớ rối, tình trạng lộn xộn.
example: The columns of hair were a ridiculous tangle of wigs, jewels, flowers...
english-definition: A confused mass of something twisted together.

question: Sự phù phiếm, tính kiêu căng, thói tự cao tự đại về ngoại hình.
example: Though such vanity would seem vulgar today...
english-definition: The fact that you are too interested in your own appearance or achievements.

question: Ganh đua, tranh giành.
example: The men vied with one another to see who wore the more expensive clothes...
english-definition: To compete with other people to achieve or get something.

question: Thô tục, tầm thường, thiếu tinh tế.
example: Though such vanity would seem vulgar today...
english-definition: Not suitable, simple, dignified or beautiful; not in the style preferred by the upper classes of society.
